paper.title: What drives stock returns across countries? Insights from machine learning models
paper.abstract: We employ machine learning techniques to examine cross-sectional variation in country equity returns by aggregating information across multiple market characteristics. Our models reveal significant return predictability, which translates into discernible patterns in portfolio performance. In addition, variable importance analysis uncovers a sparse factor structure that varies across forecast horizons. A handful of critical predictors-such as long-term reversal, momentum, earnings yield, and market size-capture most of the return differences, while country risk measures play a minor role. Consistent with the partial segmentation perspective, return predictability persists in small, illiquid, and unintegrated markets and weakens over time as the constraints on capital mobility diminish. As a result, attempts to forge them into profitable strategies can be challenging at best.

domain_result.justification: 该论文使用机器学习技术分析国家股票回报的横截面变化，并探讨了这些预测如何转化为可识别的投资组合绩效模式。这直接涉及投资组合管理的核心问题，即如何利用市场特征和预测模型来优化投资策略。
